title_en: 1931 Willie Haney Letters, Pt. 01 [Man and Wife Hunting]
comment: "There was a man and wife went out hunting and the man's wife died and the man got sick and there he had several dogs and one fise and the fise was interpreter between his master and the dogs."

notes: Ian sent me a transcription closer to the actual modern script: Yaat-łâamek ehalkon
actual word for 'hunt' is faayeeke, this fak-i is a borrowing from Creek fayetv -> fakv
Jack and Carol's modern dictionary have potakle as meaning 'middle, halfway, in between'
